entry.title: Simple to-do list for vim
entry.content:
Quick Tip: Manage a to-do list file in vim

Many times while using vim I needed to write down an idea, note or task quickly. I used to create a temporary file, but it was inefficient while working on many projects. I used to forget the file location or name. So that, I created a to-do list file (I called so because most of the items were things to do or review ) which I can easily call by typing :Todo in vim, edit it and continue working.

You can also create a simple one by adding the line below in your vimrc file.

Notice that it is important to use absolute path for your file. You can create as many files as you like of course or even add a file synced by services like Dropbox.
